name: Microscopy Single-Cell Analysis Workflow
description: Complete workflow for analyzing microscopy data with different conditions and timepoints

steps.name: prepare_input_structure
steps.description: Standardize input directory structure for LASX-exported data

steps.name: select_datatype
steps.instructions: Select the type of data: single_timepoint or multi_timepoint. You can specify the datatype when running the script with the --datatype option.
steps.description: Select the data type (single or multiple timepoints)

steps.name: select_condition
steps.instructions: Review available conditions: {conditions_list}. Select the conditions to analyze. You can specify conditions when running the script with the --conditions option.

steps.name: select_timepoints
steps.instructions: Review available timepoints in the raw data and decide which timepoints to use for analysis. Current experiment has timepoints: {timepoints_list}. Press Enter when you have made your selection. You can specify timepoints when running the script with --timepoints option.

steps.name: select_regions
steps.instructions: Review available regions in the raw data and decide which regions to use for analysis. Current experiment has regions: {regions_list}. Press Enter when you have made your selection. You can specify regions when running the script with --regions option.

steps.name: select_segmentation_channel
steps.instructions: Select the channel to use for cell segmentation. This channel will be used for binning images and interactive segmentation. Available channels: {channels_list}
steps.description: Select the channel for cell segmentation

steps.name: select_analysis_channels
steps.instructions: Select the channels to analyze. These channels will be used for all downstream analysis steps. Available channels: {channels_list}

steps.name: bin_images_for_segmentation
steps.description: Bin images 4x4 for cell segmentation using Python

steps.name: interactive_segmentation
steps.description: Launch Cellpose and FIJI for interactive cell segmentation

steps.name: roi_tracking
steps.description: Track cells by matching ROIs between time points

steps.name: resize_rois
steps.description: Resize ROIs from binned images to match original image dimensions (uses segmentation channel as reference)

steps.name: duplicate_rois_for_analysis_channels
steps.description: Create duplicate ROI files with naming conventions for each analysis channel

steps.name: extract_cells
steps.description: Extract individual cells using ROIs and save as separate files for each analysis channel

steps.name: group_cells
steps.description: Group cells by expression level and create summed images for each analysis channel
steps.notes: Optional parameters available: '--clustering-method gmm' to use GMM instead of K-means (which is now the default), '--force-clusters' to ensure all bin groups are created even with similar data

steps.name: threshold_grouped_cells
steps.description: Threshold grouped cell images to create masks for each analysis channel

steps.name: combine_masks
steps.description: Combine mask images from different bin groups into single masks for each analysis channel

steps.name: create_cell_masks
steps.description: Create individual cell masks by applying ROIs to combined masks for each analysis channel

steps.name: analyze_cell_masks
steps.description: Analyze cell masks using ImageJ and extract measurements for each analysis channel

steps.name: include_group_metadata
steps.description: Include cell group metadata in analysis results to correlate expression levels with phenotypes for each analysis channel
